snippet.title: Saturday Night Slam Masters (Arcade) Playthrough - NintendoComplete
snippet.description:
A playthrough of Capcom's 1993 wrestling arcade game, Saturday Night Slam Masters.

Played through the single battle mode on the default difficulty level with Gunloc.

Saturday Night Slam Masters, or Muscle Bomber: The Body Explosion as it was called in Japan (so much more dramatic of a name!), was a wrestling game that had way more bombast than just about any other wrestling game before it, including the excellent WWF Super Stars game released by Technos a few years earlier.

I played a ton of the SNES version of Slam Masters as a kid, and while it was a very good conversion, the arcade version really where it's at for this one. Huge character sprites, loud Q-sound driven rock beats, and a stiff but fair challenge made Saturday Night Slam Masters quite a following back in the early 90s, and it's still more than different enough from just about any other game out there to make it worth playing now.

And you get Mike Haggar as a selectable character? How cool is that?

If you'd like to see my playthroughs of the home ports, you can find them here:

SNES version:
https://youtu.be/d9StvsSD8Ew

Genesis version:
https://youtu.be/1cKKEs5q13A
 
_
No cheats were used during the recording of this video. 

NintendoComplete (http://www.nintendocomplete.com/) punches you in the face with in-depth reviews, screenshot archives, and music from classic 8-bit NES games!
